comment: He is very clear with his grading scale, and I could usually get away with devoting about two hours a week to this class overall to complete the assignments. Tests are easy and very similar to the homework - you're able to use your book. However, THE FINAL IS HARD. May drop my solid A to a B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: I took this class online and prior had good grades in Spanish. There are written assignments along with verbal recordings to submit. Verbal recordings I received 100%, yet written assignments were all 70%. He stated I didn't use verbs requested (which I did) and questioned usage of words we learned during the chapter. I would not advise taking him.

Took this as a Criminal Justice Spanish class, so a beginner Spanish class. Very difficult class. Pop quizzes every single class. You miss more than two classes. He takes points off your final grade. More than half of the class dropped it. Just stay away, the two test he gives. IMPOSSIBLE. Unless you know Spanish, you will barely pass.
rating_tags: Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Terrible professor!!! He acts like a pompous ass most of the time and expects way to much from a beginner course. Most of the class dropped the course due to his overly high expectations and poor attitude. He fails to explain things clearly and not just for me but everyone! Run as fast as you can from this moron!

WORST professor to have for learning a new language. Does not explain content clearly. You will not learn anything unless you study on your own. Very rude and disrespectful. our entire class had problems with him, almost half the class dropped it

horrible!!! i have never taken a spanish class before and he only spoke in spanish and it was 1001! he never taught us the alphabet or how to pronounce anything and he would randomly call on students, especially the ones who were struggling and put them on the spot for an answer and wouldnt take i dont know for answer. nice guy but awful teacher

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS ONLINE! A lot of homework, test and quizzes but the final was the worst part 20% You had to go to the testing center so you would think it would be online. It was 60 question all short or long answers. No multiply choice, no fill in the blank was awful. Test during class are hard to. You really need to know your spanish.

The class was ridiculous with how he decided to grade assignments. Because it was a summer class and online it was condensed, and I understand that, but he had tests, essays, and recordings due every week without giving grades for the ones the week before so you never knew where you stood or how you were doing and does NOT give good feedback.
Lectures are not very helpful. Do the VISTAS homework - it helps and is for your grade.
STAY AWAY! He is so rude to his students and never replies back to emails. The tests are hard and he is tough on grading tests, essays, and recordings. Just don't take him.

He was one of the worst professors I've taken at KSU. He was rude to students who weren't fluent. Wasn't patient. Study before you get to the class or you will look like an idiot. He's not afraid to call you out if you haven't prepared. Test are super easy though if you do the online homework, pretty much are exactly the same.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR - Especially not online. He provides zero help, and if there is a miscommunication what so ever, he will not help to correct it. This class was the worst experience of my life at KSU, which is saying something.

He is okay. I learned in the FLC that there are better teachers. If you take this class you better have the basics of spanish down! His English is just okay so sometimes it is hard for him to understand your question and can't really answer it so I taught myself a lot of things. HINT: the tests for the all class are the same no matter the teacher.
I love Professor Amparan! He is very funny and very clear about what he wants in terms of assignments. The tests are really easy if you pay attention and study. I'd definitely take him again.

Good professor! Only speaks Spanish so have some background in it... I took it in highschool 4 years ago but quickly remembered everything. Easy A for me. READ and study before lectures bc there are pop quizzes. Tests are hard for that level; I used memory from highschool level 3 spanish to makes A's on the tests. PRACTICE & SHOW UP TO CLASS.
lots of online work, dry lecturer but you'll be fine if you do your assignments

TAKE THIS CLASS! I took Spanish all through high school but never really enjoyed it or learned much. This class is so much better! He goes directly by the book and it's very easy to get a good grade. The book is very expensive but the online code is mandatory. We covered chapters 5-8. You have 3 unexcused absences. VERY GOOD!
Professor Amparan was very helpful and willing to explain anything at almost anytime. Not an incredibly easy class, but if you apply yourself, you'll do well!

Professor Amparan is a very pleasant and helpful professor.  I really enjoyed him and his teaching.Come to class everyday and you'll be more than fine.  He's easy to understand and likes class participation.  Doesn't assign a lot of in class work but he does assign homework due on the tests so pace yourself.  Overall a really great Spanish teacher!
